title: It is mandatory for all the high rise buildings to comply with the requirements of Structural Design and Stability, Geo-technical and other aspects and Fire Safety norms as per provisions of UDCPR, Maharashtra Fire (Prevention and life Safety Measures) Act, 2006 and National Building Code of India, amended from time to time, for the aspects not covered in UDCPR
clause_text: It is mandatory for all the high rise buildings to comply with the requirements of Structural Design and Stability, Geo-technical and other aspects and Fire Safety norms as per provisions of UDCPR, Maharashtra Fire (Prevention and life Safety Measures) Act, 2006 and National Building Code of India, amended from time to time, for the aspects not covered in UDCPR. The certificates from structural and geo-technical engineers about the fulfilment of necessary requirements shall be attached with the application. The responsibility of structural and other stability and safety of such high-rise buildings shall lie with owner / developer and concerned expert, consultant, executants appointed by owner / developer.
section: Buildings Abutting Two or More Streets

source_pdf.filename: UDCPR Updated 30.01.25 with earlier provisions & corrections_compressed.docx
